job_description:
QA Automation Engineer

Role Overview

We are seeking an Automation QA Engineer to bridge traditional automation with AI-driven quality engineering. You will build robust test frameworks and integrate AI tools to enhance test coverage, reduce maintenance, and accelerate CI/CD pipelines.

Key Responsibilities

  • AI-Enhanced Frameworks: Design automation frameworks (e.g., Selenium, Playwright) with AI plugins for self-healing locators to reduce flaky tests.
  • Generative QA: Use Large Language Models (LLMs) and GenAI tools to generate test cases, edge-case scenarios, and synthetic test data.
  • Shift-Left Intelligence: Implement AI tools to analyze code changes and predict test failures for faster feedback.
  • Visual Regression: Deploy AI-based tools (Applitools, Percy) to detect UI inconsistencies beyond pixel-matching.
  • Performance Insight: Apply machine learning models to analyze logs and performance metrics to identify bottlenecks.

Technical Skills & Qualifications

  • Traditional Stack: Proficiency in Java, Python, or JavaScript with experience in PyTest, TestNG, or Cypress.
  • AI Tooling: Hands-on experience or interest in AI testing platforms (Testim.io, Mabl, Functionize).
  • Prompt Engineering: Use GenAI (ChatGPT, GitHub Copilot) for script writing and test plan documentation.
  • Data Literacy: Basic understanding of AI model training/validation for testing AI-integrated features.

Contact

If this aligns with your goals, share your resume at hr-india@orthofx.com.
summary: QA Automation Engineer needed to develop AI-enhanced test frameworks and leverage GenAI tools for test case generation and visual regression. Requires proficiency in Java/Python, AI testing platforms, and prompt engineering for AI-assisted testing.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.
  • Microsoft SQL certifications (MTA Database, MCSA: SQL Server, MCSE: Data Management and Analytics) are advantageous.

Job Title: Cloud Infrastructure Architect

Company: Reflections Info Systems (P) Ltd Location: 9A2, Carnival Technopark, Kariyavattom P.O, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India, 695581 Website: www.reflectionsglobal.com Closing Date: 16, Jan 2026 Published Date: 09, Jan 2026 Contact Email: Careers@reflectionsinfos.com

Brief Description

We are seeking an experienced Cloud and Infrastructure Architect to lead enterprise-wide infrastructure strategy and implementation across public cloud platforms and on-premise data center technologies. This role requires an expert who can drive cloud adoption strategies, hybrid infrastructure design, seamless migration execution, and infrastructure security governance while aligning technical solutions with broader business and IT goals.

Responsibilities

  • Lead the development and execution of enterprise infrastructure strategies for public cloud, private cloud, and on-premise data centers.
  • Drive cloud adoption and migration programs, including assessments, migration planning, execution governance, and post-migration optimization.
  • Architect robust solutions across compute, storage, networking, virtualization, and enterprise security best standards.
  • Provide thought leadership and decision-making guidance on public cloud services, data center technologies, and emerging infrastructure trends.
  • Design and enforce strong infrastructure security practices, governance frameworks, and compliance adherence (e.g., GDPR, PCI DSS, HIPAA).
  • Collaborate with enterprise architecture, security, DevOps, application, and network teams to ensure cohesive infrastructure delivery.
  • Drive continuous improvement initiatives aimed at infrastructure scalability, automation, performance, and cost optimization.
  • Support pre-sales activities, including RFP/RFI responses, solution design, cost estimations, and client workshops.
  • Evaluate and manage partnerships with cloud providers, OEMs, and technology vendors to validate solution feasibility, strengthen service capabilities, and drive aligned GTM.
  • Develop and maintain technical documentation, accelerators, frameworks, and solution blueprints.

Preferred Skills

  • 15+ years of professional experience in IT infrastructure design, implementation, and operations, including 5+ years focused on cloud and data center architecture.
  • Proven track record in enterprise cloud migration projects, hybrid cloud strategy execution, and digital transformation initiatives.
  • Strong expertise in public cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), designing solutions using native services for compute, storage, networking, identity, security, and automation.
  • Strong background in data center technologies, including virtualization (VMware, Hyper-V), storage systems, network architecture, and infrastructure security.
  • Solid knowledge of containerization and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes/OpenShift) supporting infrastructure modernization.
  • Strong understanding of IaC and automation tools such as Terraform, Ansible, CloudFormation, ARM Templates.
  • Demonstrated expertise in security architecture and compliance, including identity management, network segmentation, and data protection.
  • Strong consulting and client engagement capabilities, assessments, solution presentations, and executive discussions.
  • Experience with enterprise monitoring, logging, and observability tools (Splunk, Prometheus, Grafana, New Relic).
  • Strong analytical skills with experience in cost assessment, TCO analysis, and infrastructure optimization for cloud and data centers.
  • Good experience in pre-sales, solution design, RFP responses, and deal support.

Application Instructions

Interested candidates may forward their detailed resumes to Careers@reflectionsinfos.com along with their notice period, current, and expected CTC details.

Important Notice: Please note that no payment is ever sought for jobs in Reflections. We contact candidates only through our official website or LinkedIn, and all employment-related emails are sent through the official HR email ID. For clarifications or alerts regarding fraudulent activities, contact Careers@reflectionsinfos.com.
summary: A Cloud Infrastructure Architect is needed to lead enterprise cloud strategies, hybrid infrastructure design, and security governance. Requires 15+ years of IT infrastructure and cloud expertise with a focus on public cloud platforms and security compliance.

If you have a deep understanding of search algorithms, technical SEO, and content strategy, along with a passion for driving results, we want to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop & Execute SEO Strategies – Define and implement a robust SEO roadmap, ensuring alignment with Way.com’s business objectives.
  • Lead & Mentor the SEO Team – Manage a team of SEO professionals, fostering a culture of continuous learning and performance excellence.
  • Optimize On-Page & Off-Page SEO – Improve keyword rankings, content performance, and backlink quality to enhance organic visibility.
  • Technical SEO Management – Identify and resolve site architecture issues, crawl errors, indexing problems, and page speed optimizations.
  • Data-Driven Decision Making – Analyze traffic trends, keyword performance, and search visibility using tools like Google Analytics, Search Console, SEMrush, and Ahrefs.
  • Content & Product Collaboration – Work closely with content creators, developers, and product teams to integrate SEO best practices into website enhancements.
  • Local & Mobile SEO Optimization – Enhance local search presence and mobile-first indexing strategies to improve search rankings.
  • Competitive & Market Analysis – Conduct SEO audits, monitor competitor strategies, and identify new opportunities to stay ahead in the industry.
  • SEO Performance Reporting – Provide insights and actionable recommendations through detailed SEO reports and dashboards.

Preferred Skills

  • 9-11 years of SEO experience, with at least 2 years in a team lead role.
  • Proven expertise in technical SEO, content strategy, and link-building.
  • Strong knowledge of search engine algorithms, ranking factors, and SEO trends.
  • Proficiency in Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEMrush, Ahrefs, Screaming Frog, and other SEO tools.
  • Strong understanding of mobile-first indexing, Core Web Vitals, and structured data (schema markup).
  • Experience with A/B testing, conversion rate optimization (CRO), and SEO for local businesses (Google My Business optimization).
  • Ability to analyze and interpret SEO data to make data-driven decisions.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and website development principles.
  • Understanding of PPC advertising and its relationship with organic search.
  • Experience working in a high-growth startup or fast-paced environment.
  • Familiarity with social media marketing and its impact on SEO.
  • Strong project management skills, with the ability to prioritize and execute multiple SEO initiatives.

Why You Will Love Working With Us

  • Opportunity to work for the #1 Auto Super app in the US.
  • Opportunity to make a meaningful impact across 10+ million users.
  • Dynamic, fast-paced, and innovation-driven work culture.
  • Clear pathways for career growth in a rapidly scaling technology company.
  • Competitive compensation.
